relation: Name (logical volumes created for internal use are enclosed in brackets)
Full name of logical volume including its volume group, namely VG/LV
Full pathname for logical volume (blank for internal logical volumes)
Internal device mapper pathname for logical volume (in /dev/mapper directory)
For logical volumes that are components of another logical volume, the parent logical volume
Set if mirror/RAID images underwent initial resynchronization
Set if mirror/RAID image is synchronized
Set if snapshot logical volume is being merged to origin
Set if logical volume is being converted
Set if logical volume is locked against allocation changes
Set if logical volume has fixed minor number assigned
Set if snapshot logical volume is invalid
Set if logical volume is skipped on activation
For thin pools, behavior when full
Active state of the logical volume
Set if the logical volume is active locally
Set if the logical volume is active remotely
Set if the logical volume is active exclusively
Persistent major number or -1 if not persistent
Persistent minor number or -1 if not persistent
Read ahead setting in current units
Size of logical volume in current units
For thin and cache pools, the size of the logical volume that holds the metadata
Number of segments in logical volume
For snapshots, the origin device of this logical volume
For snapshots, the size of the origin device of this logical volume
For snapshot and thin pools and volumes, the percentage full if logical volume is active
For snapshots, the percentage full if logical volume is active
For thin pools, the percentage of metadata full if logical volume is active
For RAID, mirrors and pvmove, current percentage in-sync
For RAID, mirrors and pvmove, current percentage in-sync
For RAID, number of mismatches found or repaired
For RAID, the current synchronization action being performed
For RAID1, the number of outstanding writes allowed to writemostly devices
For RAID1, the minimum recovery I/O load in kiB/sec/disk
For RAID1, the maximum recovery I/O load in kiB/sec/disk
For pvmove, source physical volume of temporary logical volume created by pvmove
For lvconvert, name of temporary logical volume created by lvconvert
For mirrors, the logical volume holding the synchronization log
For thin and cache pools, the logical volume holding the associated data
For thin and cache pools, the logical volume holding the associated metadata
For thin volumes, the thin pool logical volume for this volume
Configuration profile attached to this logical volume
Creation time of the logical volume, if known
Creation host of the logical volume, if known
Kernel device-mapper modules required for this logical volume

textAfterTable: Table C.6, “Logical Volume Device Combined Info and Status Fields” describes the logical volume device fields that combine both logical device info and logical device status. ⁠ Table C.6. Logical Volume Device Combined Info and Status Fields Logical Volume Field Description Field Type lv_attr Selects according to both logical volume device info as well as logical volume status. string Table C.7, “Logical Volume Device Info Fields” describes the logical volume device info fields and their field types. ⁠ Table C.7. Logical Volume Device Info Fields Logical Volume Field Description Field Type lv_kernel_major Currently assigned major number or -1 if logical volume is not active number lv_kernel_minor Currently assigned minor number or -1 if logical volume is not active number lv_kernel_read_ahead Currently-in-use read ahead setting in current units size lv_permissions
